rmfSteps.title: Categorize
rmfSteps.description: Categorize the system and information processed, stored, and transmitted based on impact analysis
activities: Identify system boundaries and authorization boundaries
Conduct FIPS 199 impact analysis (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability)
Determine system impact level (Low, Moderate, High)
Document categorization in System Security Plan (SSP)
rmfSteps.dodInstruction: DoD 8510.01 - Risk Management Framework (RMF) for DoD IT

rmfSteps.title: Select
rmfSteps.description: Select appropriate security controls based on system categorization and tailoring guidance
activities: Apply tailoring guidance based on organizational requirements
Apply overlay for specific environments (e.g., IL5/IL6, Cloud)
Supplement controls based on risk assessment

rmfSteps.title: Implement
rmfSteps.description: Implement security controls and document implementation details

rmfSteps.title: Assess
rmfSteps.description: Assess security controls to determine effectiveness
activities: Document findings in Security Assessment Report (SAR)

rmfSteps.title: Authorize
rmfSteps.description: Authorize system operation based on risk determination
activities: Prepare authorization package (SSP, SAP, SAR, POA&M)
AO reviews risk and makes authorization decision
Issue Authority to Operate (ATO), Interim ATO (IATO), or Denial

rmfSteps.title: Monitor
rmfSteps.description: Continuously monitor security controls and system changes
activities: Track POA&M items and remediation progress

rmfOverview.description: The Risk Management Framework (RMF) provides a disciplined and structured process that integrates information security and risk management activities into the system development life cycle.
rmfOverview.purpose: To ensure that managing information system-related security risks is consistent with the mission and business objectives of the organization.
rmfOverview.applicability: All DoD information systems, including cloud systems, weapon systems, and platform IT systems.
keyPrinciples: Risk-based approach to security control selection
